match.title: 2nd ODI
match.statusText: Bangladesh won by 7 wickets (with 71 balls remaining)

image.caption: Fans enjoy a domestic Twenty20 match at the Shere-Bangla Stadium
image.longCaption: Fans enjoy a domestic Twenty20 match at the Shere-Bangla Stadium, Mirpur, October 15, 2009

match.hoursInfo: 14.30 start, First Session 14.30-18.00, Interval 18.00-18.45, Second Session 18.45-22.15

headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Rizwan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Saad Nasim not out 77 (96b 6x4 1x6 115m) SR: 80.2
Wahab Riaz not out 51 (40b 5x4 2x6 47m) SR: 127.5

headshotImage.caption: Azhar Ali player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Azhar Ali player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Brilliant catch from Mushfiq! This was pushed through outside off and turns away a bit. Azhar seeks to reverse-sweep it away and only manages to run it off the face to the right of Mushfiq, who anticipates well. The ball bobbled out on the first attempt, it hits his stomach and Mushfiq then hangs on to it on the rebound, clutching the ball against his body

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Rizwan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Rizwan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Rizwan has been pinned lbw. The forefinger goes up, he ponders over a review and decides against it. He starts walking off. This was pushed through, arm-ball, beats the inside edge of Rizwan on the defensive push. Trapped in front of off. He could have reviewed that as replays show that the impact was outside off

headshotImage.caption: Fawad Alam player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Fawad Alam player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Fawad Alam bags a duck and leaves Pakistan in tatters at 59 for 4. This was flatter and quicker, comes in with the angle from round the stumps and skids on at 85.1ks. Fawad's bat came down at an angle, he misses the cut and the ball crashes into middle. Nasir lets out a big roar

dismissalText.long: c Soumya Sarkar b Rubel Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: Sarfaraz Ahmed c Soumya Sarkar b Rubel Hossain 7 (11b 0x4 0x6 33m) SR: 63.63

dismissalComment.html: And he strikes with his first ball. This was on a back of a length and zipping through outside off with some good extra bounce. Sarfraz is on the move as he pushes at it away from he body. Nicks it off, Sarkar flings to his right at slip and pouches it at wide slip. Then tumbles onto the ground.

dismissalText.commentary: Mohammad Hafeez b Arafat Sunny 0 (6b 0x4 0x6 8m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: The middle stump has been pegged back and Sunny exults as Hafeez perishes for a duck. This was the arm-ball, slides in with the angle at 86.6ks and skids through. Hafeez is crease-bound and brings his bat down late. Timber!

headshotImage.caption: Azhar Ali player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Azhar Ali player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Azhar Ali player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Azhar Ali player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c †Mushfiqur Rahim b Shakib Al Hasan
dismissalText.commentary: Azhar Ali c †Mushfiqur Rahim b Shakib Al Hasan 36 (60b 5x4 0x6 69m) SR: 60

headshotImage.longCaption: Fawad Alam player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Fawad Alam b Nasir Hossain 0 (6b 0x4 0x6 8m) SR: 0

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Rizwan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Rizwan player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Rizwan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Rizwan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mohammad Rizwan lbw b Shakib Al Hasan 13 (22b 2x4 0x6 18m) SR: 59.09

dismissalComment.html: Rizwan has been pinned lbw. The forefinger goes up, he ponders over a review and decides against it. He starts walking off. This was pushed through, arm-ball, beats the inside edge of Rizwan on the defensive push. Trapped in front of off. He could have reviewed that as replays show that the impact was outside off

dismissalText.commentary: Haris Sohail c & b Mashrafe Mortaza 44 (61b 1x4 1x6 123m) SR: 72.13

dismissalComment.html: Haris lobs it back to the bowler for a simple return catch. First wicket for Mashrafe in his 150th ODI. Haris throws his head back in despair. Good length ball outside off, slowy in pace at 112kph. Haris was early into the stroke, chipping it back to the bowler

dismissalText.commentary: Tamim Iqbal not out 116 (116b 17x4 1x6 190m) SR: 100

headshotImage.caption: Fawad Alam player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Fawad Alam player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Fawad Alam b Rahat Ali
dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim c Fawad Alam b Rahat Ali 65 (70b 8x4 1x6 104m) SR: 92.85

dismissalComment.html: The second grab does it for Alam. Good length slowy ball angling away outside off at 119.2ks, he slices it to Fawad at point, who messes it up on the first attempt. But recovers and pouches it on the second. Mushfiq raises his bat and acknowledges the applause as he walks back. He was undone by the change of pace

headshotImage.caption: Saeed Ajmal player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Saeed Ajmal player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: first wicket on international return for Ajmal. This was tossed up and spins in to strike middle as Mahmudullah sinks to one knee and does not meet with the slog sweep

headshotImage.caption: Junaid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Junaid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Junaid strikes. This was fuller and curling away outside off, Sarkar seeks to drive with his feet in cement. He can only feather it to Sarfraz, who moves to his left and snaffles it. Good retort from Junaid after being hit for three successive fours

headshotImage.caption: Junaid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Junaid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Soumya Sarkar c †Sarfaraz Ahmed b Junaid Khan 17 (11b 4x4 0x6 12m) SR: 154.54

dismissalComment.html: Junaid strikes. This was fuller and curling away outside off, Sarkar seeks to drive with his feet in cement. He can only feather it to Sarfraz, who moves to his left and snaffles it. Good retort from Junaid after being hit for three successive fours

headshotImage.caption: Saeed Ajmal player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Saeed Ajmal player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mahmudullah b Saeed Ajmal 17 (28b 2x4 0x6 52m) SR: 60.71

dismissalComment.html: first wicket on international return for Ajmal. This was tossed up and spins in to strike middle as Mahmudullah sinks to one knee and does not meet with the slog sweep

headshotImage.caption: Fawad Alam player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Fawad Alam player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Fawad Alam b Rahat Ali
dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim c Fawad Alam b Rahat Ali 65 (70b 8x4 1x6 104m) SR: 92.85

dismissalComment.html: The second grab does it for Alam. Good length slowy ball angling away outside off at 119.2ks, he slices it to Fawad at point, who messes it up on the first attempt. But recovers and pouches it on the second. Mushfiq raises his bat and acknowledges the applause as he walks back. He was undone by the change of pace

commentTextItems.html: Bangladesh win, clinch the series, and make history. This is their first series win over Pakistan. Flatter and on middle and leg, nuggety nurdle behind square leg

commentPostTextItems.html: Read Karthik's report and watch out for Isam's insights. Do come back and join us for the third and final ODI. Goodbye and g'night for now.

Tamim Iqbal, Man of the Match: I was not in the best of form before the series. But all came good. I am very happy now. I was under pressure in the first game. I just enjoyed myself and played my shots today.

Mashrafe Mortaza, Bangladesh captain: The boys are very happy. The job is not done yet, we have one more game to go. Shakib did well in the first match. This match was almost a perfect one. Tamim Iqbal and Mushfiqur Rahim have been brilliant.

Azhar Ali, Pakistan captain: I think we did not bat well in the first half. 240 was not good enough. Saad Nasim and Wahab Riaz helped us comeback, but it was not enough. We are rebuilding. We will learn from this. The boys will bounce back. We have been struck by injuries and a few seniors have retired. We have to trust the youngsters. They will definitely come good.
9:55pm: The players exchange pleasantries. Tamim raises his bat as he walks back. Chandika Hathurusingha greets Tamim and pats him.

He led Bangladesh's batting again, completing back-to-back centuries. Tamim began the chase with a flurry of boundaries and stayed there till the end to guide Bangladesh to a famous win. Mushfiq missed a century this time, but his breezy 65 injected impetus to the chase when Tamim slowed down briefly in the middle overs. The Pakistan bowlers erred in line and length and lacked penetration. The visitors' only respite came when a floodlight tower failed in the 30th over, causing a 15-minute delay.
Shakib said that Bangladesh were favourites heading into the series and they have backed up the claim and how!
ASM Jahangir: "It's a proud moment for Bangladesh cricket. And that also in style by winning two games in a row. What a performance!!! Congrats to Bangladesh team, especially to Tamim and Mushfiq."

TTA: "Pakistan cricket is at its lowest with their most inexperienced team in years, whereas Bangladesh is in great form and with established players like Shakib, Tamim, Mushfiq and Mashrafee as the pillars of the team BD has their best team ever. The result really tells the story
SamRoy: "16 year wait for 2nd win, 2 day wait for 3rd..."

commentTextItems.html: dug in shortish and outside off, eased to third man with an open face. Scores are level

headshotImage.caption: Junaid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Junaid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: pitched up and outside off, tapped to extra-cover for one
low full toss on middle and leg, whipped away in front of square on the leg side
bouncer outside off, Tamim jerks his head out of the way. Wide called, for there was too much height on this
Tamim runs down the track, manufactures a length ball and deposits it over long-on. Just wide of the sightscreen
shortish and outside off, dinked to point with an open face
pitched up and outside off, he lays into a drive and flays it past the covers
width on offer outside off, short as well. Shakib executes a cut and sends it scurrying past point

headshotImage.caption: Junaid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Junaid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: angled in on off, patted into the covers
fuller on middle and leg, clipped through midwicket
dug in on a back of a length and outside off, slashed over backward point to third man

dismissalText.long: c Fawad Alam b Rahat Ali
dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim c Fawad Alam b Rahat Ali 65 (70b 8x4 1x6 104m) SR: 92.85

commentTextItems.html: The second grab does it for Alam. Good length slowy ball angling away outside off at 119.2ks, he slices it to Fawad at point, who messes it up on the first attempt. But recovers and pouches it on the second. Mushfiq raises his bat and acknowledges the applause as he walks back. He was undone by the change of pace

commentPostTextItems.html: Lakshitha: "I read the commentary as Four successive centuries for Tamim...! And then saw the comma between four and centuries... Well played young man...!"

commentTextItems.html: shortish and angled across, extra lift on this foils Mushfiq's attempted dab to third man. Beaten
tucked away off the pads to deep backward square leg

headshotImage.caption: Junaid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Junaid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: he dabs this in front of the covers and sets off for a single. Mushfiq reciprocated well
good length ball angled in on off, Mushfiq aims to drive through mid-off, manages an inside edge to leg
fuller and on middle and leg, clipped towards deep midwicket
Successive centuries for Tamim, he is pumped. Too fuller and on the leg stump, glanced away fine. He has his hands aloft in celebration and then swings his bat vigorously in the air
near yorker on middle and leg, swings in, Tamim jabs his bat down and keeps it out

headshotImage.longCaption: Azhar Ali player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Junaid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Junaid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Soumya Sarkar c †Sarfaraz Ahmed b Junaid Khan 17 (11b 4x4 0x6 12m) SR: 154.54

dismissalComment.html: Junaid strikes. This was fuller and curling away outside off, Sarkar seeks to drive with his feet in cement. He can only feather it to Sarfraz, who moves to his left and snaffles it. Good retort from Junaid after being hit for three successive fours

headshotImage.caption: Saeed Ajmal player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Saeed Ajmal player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mahmudullah b Saeed Ajmal 17 (28b 2x4 0x6 52m) SR: 60.71

dismissalComment.html: first wicket on international return for Ajmal. This was tossed up and spins in to strike middle as Mahmudullah sinks to one knee and does not meet with the slog sweep

headshotImage.caption: Fawad Alam player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Fawad Alam player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Fawad Alam b Rahat Ali
dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim c Fawad Alam b Rahat Ali 65 (70b 8x4 1x6 104m) SR: 92.85

dismissalComment.html: The second grab does it for Alam. Good length slowy ball angling away outside off at 119.2ks, he slices it to Fawad at point, who messes it up on the first attempt. But recovers and pouches it on the second. Mushfiq raises his bat and acknowledges the applause as he walks back. He was undone by the change of pace
